gurmukhi: ਸਨੱਧਬੱਧ ਹੁੲਿ ਚਲੇ ॥ ਸੁ ਬੀਰ ਬੀਰ ਹਾ ਭਲੇ ॥੧੮੭॥
transliteration: Sanaddh-baddh Hue Chale|| Su Beer Beer Haa Bhale||187||
translation: They went having been completely embellished. These brave men were of very gentle demeanour.187.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਦੇਸ ਦੇਸ ਗਾਹ ਕੈ ॥ ਅਦਾਹ ਠੳੁਰ ਦਾਹ ਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Bides Des Gadh Kai|| Adaah Thaur Daah Kai||
translation: They roamed in several countries, both inland and foreign and at all the places they destroyed (the pride of) all with the blaze of their glory.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਾੲਿ ਬਾਜ ਰਾਜ ਕੱੳੁ ॥ ਸੁਧਾਰ ਰਾਜ ਕਾਜ ਕੱੳੁ ॥੧੮੮॥
transliteration: Phiraae Baaj Raaj Kau|| Sudhaar Raaj Kaaj Kau||188||
translation: They caused their horse to revolve on all the four sides and in this way they enhanced the royal prestige of king Dasrath.188.

gurmukhi: ਨਰੇਸ ਪਾੲਿ ਲਾਗੀਯੰ ॥ ਦੁਰੰਤ ਦੋਖ ਭਾਗੀਯੰ ॥
transliteration: Dares Paae Laageeyan|| Durant Dokh Bhaageeyan||
translation: Many kings bowed at his feet and he removed all their agonies.

gurmukhi: ਸੁ ਪੂਰ ਜੱਗ ਕੋ ਕਰਯੋ ॥ ਨਰੇਸ ਤ੍ਰਾਸ ਕੳੁ ਹਰਯੋ ॥੧੮੯॥
transliteration: Su Poor Jagg Ko Daryo|| Dares Traas Kau Daryo||189||
translation: He completed his Yajna and in this way destroyed the anguish of his subjects.189.

gurmukhi: ਅਨੰਤ ਦਾਨ ਪਾੲਿ ਕੈ ॥ ਚਲੇ ਦਿਜੰ ਅਘਾੲਿ ਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Anant Daan Paae Kai|| Chale Dijan Aghaae Kai||
translation: Receiving the gifts of many kinds the Brahmins pleased and satisfied in their mind; they moved back to their places.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਰੰਤ ਅਾਸਿਖੈਂ ਰੜੈਂ ॥ ਰਿਚਾ ਸੁ ਬੇਦ ਕੀ ਪੜੈਂ ॥੧੯੦॥
transliteration: Durant Aasikhain Ratain|| Richaa Su Bed Kipatain||190||
translation: Giving the blessing of various kinds and singing the Vedic mantras.190.

gurmukhi: ਨਰੇਸ ਦੇਸ ਦੇਸ ਕੇ ॥ ਸੁਭੰਤ ਬੇਸ ਬੇਸ ਕੇ ॥
transliteration: Dares Des Des Ke|| Soubhant Bes Bes Ke||
translation: The kings of the inland and foreign countries decorate themselves in various garbs,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਸੇਖ ਸੂਰ ਸੋਭਰੀਂ ॥ ਸੁਸੀਲ ਨਾਰਿ ਲੋਭਹੀਂ ॥੧੯੧॥
transliteration: Bisekh Soor Sobh-heen|| Souseel Daar(i) Lobh-heen||191||
translation: And noticing the significant glory of the warriors, the beautiful and cultured women were allured towards them.191.

gurmukhi: ਬਜੰਤ੍ਰ ਕੋਟ ਬਾਜਹੀਂ ॥ ਸਨਾੲਿ ਭੇਰ ਸਾਜਹੀਂ ॥
transliteration: Bajanaatra Kot Baaj-heen|| Sanaae Bher Saaj-heen
translation: Millions of musical instruments were played and all the bedecked persons were full of love.

gurmukhi: ਬਨਾੲਿ ਦੇਵਤਾ ਧਰੈਂ ॥ ਸਮਾਨ ਜਾੲਿ ਪਾ ਪਰੈਂ ॥੧੯੨॥
transliteration: Banaae Devtaa Ddarain|| Samaan Jaae Paa Darain||192||
translation: The idols of gods were established and all were bowing with respect to the gods, expressing their gratitude.192.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੈ ਡੰਡੳੁਤ ਪਾ ਪਰੈਂ ॥ ਬਿਸੇਖ ਭਾਵਨਾ ਧਰੈਂ ॥
transliteration: Darai Dandaur Paa Darain|| Bisekh Bhaavnaa Ddarain||
translation: All the people prostrated and bowed at the feet of gods and were assuming significant emotions in their minds.

gurmukhi: ਸੁ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਜੰਤ੍ਰ ਜਾਪੀਅੈ ॥ ਦੁਰੰਤ ਥਾਪ ਥਾਪੀਅੈ ॥੧੯੩॥
transliteration: Su Mantra Jantra Jaapeeai|| Durant Thaap Thaapeeai||193||
translation: Therefore was recitation of mantras and yantras and the idols of Ganas were being fixed.193.

gurmukhi: ਨਚਾਤ ਚਾਰੁ ਮੰਗਨਾ ॥ ਸੁ ਜਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਅੰਗਨਾ ॥
transliteration: Nachaat Chaar(u) Mannaa|| Su Jaan Dev Annaa||
translation: Beautiful women and heavenly damsels began to dance.
